clinical_study.official_title: Acute and Brief Intervention Following Mild Traumatic Brain Injury: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

oversight_info.authority: Canada: Ministère santé et services sociaux du Québec
Canada: Public Health Agency of Canada

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to implement and measure the efficiency of a standardized acute and brief non-pharmacological intervention (Cognitive interventions on Sleep - Anxiety - Attention - Memory) following mild TBI and observe their impact pre- and post-treatments. The ultimate goal is to have patients be re-integrated to their activities faster with lesser symptoms and have patients present lesser post-concussive symptoms. Specific objectives: 1) Measure the effect of an acute and brief non-pharmacological intervention on PCS symptoms, sleep, headaches, affect, cognition and functional outcome following mild TBI; 2)To redefine a model of outcome prediction following mild TBI.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Mild TBI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Psychiatric diagnosis
